intro: Mouriri parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved mouriri, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains numerous seeds.
